thread.title: ‘The Keeping Room’ review: Exploitation that’s respectable
thread.title_full: ‘The Keeping Room’ review: Exploitation that’s respectable - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Mick LaSalle
title: ‘The Keeping Room’ review: Exploitation that’s respectable
text:
Photo: Handout, McClatchy-Tribune News Service Brit Marling is grounded yet emotionally forceful as one of three captives at the end of the Civil War. Brit Marling is grounded yet emotionally forceful as one of three...
“The Keeping Room” can be looked at as just another nasty exploitation film, with three women stuck in a house and a pair of well-armed psychos trying to get inside. But it’s set at the end of the Civil War, which gives it historical heft, and it stars Brit Marling, whose aura of seriousness and integrity lift the movie into something approaching respectability. Brit Marling is grounded yet emotionally forceful as one of three captives at the end of the Civil War. Brit Marling is grounded yet emotionally forceful as one of three...
“The Keeping Room” can be looked at as just another nasty exploitation film, with three women stuck in a house and a pair of well-armed psychos trying to get inside. But it’s set at the end of the Civil War, which gives it historical heft, and it stars Brit Marling, whose aura of seriousness and integrity lift the movie into something approaching respectability.
